column1: That seems like a good price.
column2: Exactly!  The roofer told me that since I replaced my roof and the leak was still there, the problem had to be my fireplace chimney.  He said stone chimneys often develop leaks.  As it turns out, this chimney guy fabricates a type of gutter for chimneys to keep the water from running down the rock.  For $300 he made and installed the "gutter" on site, and I have had NO leaks!

column1: That sounds tough.  How do you think you did?

column1: Me, too--I'm sorrry you had to go through that.  At least it's over now, right?
column2: Horrible, my palms were sweaty the entire time. I hate talking in front of large crowds.

column2: yes i received a fake product , the make of earphones is very well known brand

column1: Oh no that is so frustrating! What did you do?
column2: I had the worst day ever yesterday.  I had just finished a long, hard day at work, I had driven the 40 minutes home, was just driving into my street and realised that I had left my bag with phone, purse and most importantly my house keys back in the office!

column1: Ah yes, a glass of wine might help to make that feel better. Still, what a pain. Lousy end to a lousy day.
column2: Well I wanted to cry and scream, I was so cross with myself but unfortunately as I live alone I just had to drive the 40 minutes back to the office to get them then another 40mins back home.  Where i swiftly had a little glass of wine to help lol.

column1: I would be so lost without my phone, but I could make it through an evening. The house keys though!
column2: Exactly, so irritating.  But hey you live and learn, I guarantee you I will never leave work again without double then triple checking that I have all my belongings with me!

column1: Was it some fraudulent transaction posted on your account?

column2: ya i had bruises on my leg

column1: Are you willing to go on another safari?
column2: it attacked me and ran into the bushes . it was a very bad experience.

column1: I'm not surprised.
column2: no i am done with such trips.

column1: That's very intense. I am sorry you had to experience that.
column2: My husbands brother was getting married.  I searched online and in every shop to find the perfect dress.  I finally found it, tried it on and loved it.  I couldnt buy it until the following week as I had to wait to payday so I left it over in the store.  The next day my sister in law called in.  She had been shopping and had also found the perfect dress.  She took it out of the bag to show me and I discovered it was the same dress!! Couldnt believe it.  Oh how I resented her at that moment.

column1: That's good. Time heals all wounds and can be a powerful cure to pain and disdain.
column2: Oh if envy could kill - she would have been dead on the spot.  Needless to say I got over it and found another dress but just at that moment on that day...

column1: You are telling me you are a hoarder?
column2: I never can get myself to give away their baby items.

column1: Everyone is nostalgic one way or another.You are fine
column2: lol no I just can't part with items that mean a lot to me like my kids baby things like first shirts ect.

column1: Oh my goodness! Thats terrible. Did anyone see? My face would be bright red.
column2: I was walking down the street yesterday in my brand new summer dress.  I though i was gorgeous! Suddenly a big gust of wind came and blew my dress up around my ears! Where I succeeded in flashing my underwear to the entire street.  Oh the embarrassment.

column1: I'm sure this will be one of those times where you cringe when you think back on it! I'm sure you made those guy's days though
column2: Oh my face was very red indeed and yes unfortunately I got a hugh cheer from a group of lads who witnessed it all.  I was so mortified I just ran home.  Later though I chatted about it with my friends and was finally able to laugh about it.

column1: That's crazy! I'm glad there was nothing there.

column1: Some horror movies are so great that they make you consider your own environment.
column2: Oh no just my vivid imagination lol.  I do love a good horror but usually I watch them with my husband.  I am clearly not as brave on my own!!

column1: That's great. I bet it was wonderful experience.

column1: That's cool. Taking that experience into the next phase will be pivotal.
column2: It was she wasn't really good ans i had no problem helping

column2: no it was a minor accident , but car got damaged little

column1: Dang, that sucks. I hope you can find a solution for that

column1: Wow, you must be proud! He might cure cancer next!

column1: Geniuses don't do chores my friend.

column1: I'm so sorry to hear about your mom. It's good that you're at peace with it, though.

column1: But a part of her is still here in you.
column2: Yeah, she's in a better place now.

column1: They left you all alone? I bet you feel lonely...

column2: Yeah, it was cool for a while, but the house is way to quiet now

column1: I know right. I would be so furious!
column2: I need to interrogate everyone in this house. I'm so angry. You don't mess with Mom's Pop Tarts!

column1: I would do it! Try to be calm about it at first and see how he responds.

column1: Yeah, something should be done about it!
column2: No, next time I might snap. They never show any consideration for anybody on the block. They do whatever they want.

column1: I've done that before when I was just annoyed with them. Don't feel bad!
column2: My friend wanted to go to lunch today. I told her I was busy, but really I just didn't want to go...

column1: Who cares! I always like to think of satisfying myself first before others!
column2: Well, I do feel a little guilty, just sitting here on my couch watching tv

column1: What a pain! I bet that cost a fortune. Did they end up repairing all the portions of yard that they had to rip up?
column2: It was truly disgusting. We had to have a crew of plumbers come in and dig up our yard.

column1: Well, that was nice of them. I hope you take them out to dinner after you pay them back.

column1: OH NO! That's infuriating. Did the stain come out?

column1: Hopefully they remember
column2: Yes, but I had to spend extra money to get the carpet shampooed. I gave them a spanking that they will never forget. I'm not putting up with this no more.

column1: Did you brush it right out?

column2: I'm not sure, I might just stay in the shallow part of the pool.

column1: Awesome! I bet you felt proud at what you accomplished. Did you have this goal in mind for a while?

column2: Yes. I've wanted to be healthier, but I also wanted to look hot and feel confident at this event.

column1: Thats awesome.  I wish I could go.  Where are you going?

column1: Cruises are awesome.  You get to eat as much food as you want.  You'll probably put on like 10 pounds

column1: Aww man, I hope you brought your raincoat.

column1: That's good, you don't want to get soaked and catch a cold.

column1: That's amazing. You must have been so surprised and happy!

column1: Did you get a video of it?
column2: Totally, I was in shock.

column1: Gee, he must have been really hungry! That's a lot of eggs!

column1: Wow.. that's unbelievable. I wonder how his cholesterol is.
column2: I stayed to watch to see if he'd eat them all. He did. I was very impressed.

column1: Oh dang, that really sucks. I can't believe TSA would go that far, it must've been super embarrassing.

column1: Dude, you should definitely report it someone or the company because you could probably get something out of it.
column2: Yeah, I will never show my face there again.

column1: Oh yeah, what was it called? I really love roller coasters!
column2: I rode the largest roller coaster I've ever ridden this summer.

column1: I saw that one on TV. It looks absolutely nuts. I hope to visit Cedar Point one day!
column2: Millenium Force, in Cedar Point. It was utterly terrifying.

column1: Oh, I hope you get some good news. I am sure it would help you getting aid for college.
column2: I'm waiting to hear back from a few colleges about scholarships.

column1: All you can do is be patient and see what happens. I am sure everything will work out for you.
column2: Yes, I think my stats are good. I'm hopeful there will be some good news soon.

column1: That's awesome. I hope it works out for your friend and their fiancee. Are you excited to be there?
column2: My best friend is getting married next weekend. I'm in the wedding.

column1: Well I am sure they appreciate you being a part of their big day. Enjoy the after party!
column2: Super excited! These two have been together forever. It's about time they made it legit!

column1: Wow, that sounds fun. What type of artwork did you see?
column2: I went to a fancy art showing at a gallery last night.

column1: Gee, she must have her hands full! I hope she does well as an artist!
column2: It was watercolors. My neighbor was the artist. I had no idea she did such great work. She also has two toddlers. I have no idea how she manages all of that.

column1: Did you feel very emasculated by this?
column2: I thought I could lift, but my wife upstaged me by benching 150 lbs at the gym the other day. I can only lift 130 lbs.

column1: Yeah, I can see that viewpoint as well. She may end up carrying you to bed next time!
column2: No, it actually turned me on. I didn't know she was that strong.

column1: I'm glad he returned home safe and sound. Did he have fun on the camping trip?
column2: My son came back from a camping trip last night. I was great to have him safely home again.

column1: My mom was the same way. It's all part of being a parent. I hope to have kids soon too and I worry about stuff concerning them myself!
column2: He did. I'm a worrier, but I need to learn to let go more.

column1: Oh wow, I bet the emotions of that came back to you.
column2: I came across my wedding albums the other day and showed them to my kids.

column1: Yes, those memories are what make life so special.
column2: Yes, it was so much fun to see the younger version of me and my husband, pre-kids. Very sentimental.

column1: So, not a surprise, but still nice to get?
column2: I got a car for my birthday, but I kinda knew I was going to get it beforehand because I kept telling my wife I wanted it.

column1: That's sweet.
column2: Yeah, kind of ruined the surprise, but I can always count on my wife to make me feel special.

column1: Yeah those were the days. When we had no worries in the world.
column2: i miss my childhood and living with my parents

column1: That sounds really cool. I always wanted a treehouse but never had a good tree for it.
column2: yes indeed.  i wish i had my treehouse back that my dad built for me.  i would live in it.

column1: Oh yeah, why is that?
column2: i live next to a football field and every football season i hate living here

column1: I would have them towed!
column2: Because they park in my driveway!

column1: Oh so you have to have a sign up to legally tow them?
column2: i have signs up this year, so i can do that legally!

column1: Or you could just park behind them so that they would have to knock on your door before you let them out.
column2: Yes. Which i think is wrong.  If they are on my property i should have the right without the sign.

column1: That's awesome. Which Disney park did you go to?
column2: my husband treated me to a week at disney, i had no idea!

column1: Ooh I live pretty close to it. You have a great husband to give you that treat!
column2: disney world. it's the only one Ive ever been to .

column1: That's good that you found happiness. That's what were all in the pursuit of right?
column2: i am pretty happy right now, i don't think i have ever been happier with my life.

column1: You are blessed. Make sure to spread the positive energy.
column2: Exactly! I used to struggle but i don't anymore

column1: that's great that you can trust her.  how old?
column2: My daughter went out of town, but she promised me she wouldn't do anything I wouldn't approve of, and I believe her, so I let her go.

column1: That's great. Be thankful, some people aren't so lucky.
column2: Yeah, she's a good kid and hasn't given me any reason to think otherwise. She just turned 18.

column1: what did you almost buy?
column2: Man I can't believe I almost bought that thing at Walmart!

column1: It's hard to find good quality at walmart
column2: It was a combination rice-cooker and vegetable steamer.  It looked so good in the ad, but when I got there, it looked cheap and shabby!

column1: I would try target.  good quality stuff there.
column2: I hope I can find one that lives up to the promise of that ad.  Maybe somwhere else, right?

column1: try googling it, and read thru the reviews
column2: I could try online, but I'd have to buy it first and then see if it's good quality.

column1: Finding a buyer can be tough.  You have a good agent?
column2: i am trying to sell my house, i hope i can find a buyer

column1: Does it have a good location?  You know the only rule of real estate, right?  Location, Location, Location.
column2: I hope i do.  We will see, I know it can take a while.\

column1: Sounds good.  Definitely should target a family buyer then
column2: yes i live behind a school.

column1: You got a figure in mind for your house or are you letting the agent handle that as well?
column2: yes, but i will leave that to the listing agent.

column1: Thats never good when you have a bad manager.  What made them so bad?
column2: I had to leave my last job because this manager they brought in was such an incompetent doofus.

column1: Know it alls are the worst.  Hopefully you are in a better spot now, with a manager who cares.
column2: He was the "marketing manager" but couldn't market his way out of a paper bag, it was impossible to work with him. Plus he thought he knew everything which made it worse.

column1: Oh no! What's wrong with your dad?
column2: i am concerned about my father

column1: Aw, I'm so sorry to hear that. It's not easy to watch our parents age.
column2: he is old, and he lives alone.  i just worry because he is getting old.  he gets on ok, but i don't know how much longer.

column1: We can surely hope!
column2: no it's not, but hopefully our kids will do the same for us some day.

column1: That must have made you feel terrible. Were you able to find the dog?
column2: My neighbor asked me to watch over his dog. I told him he could trust me, but he escaped and ran away.

column1: I sincerely hope you can find him! But I bet your neighbor will understand it was just a mistake and you didn't do it on purpose.

column1: Doesn't he understand that people have to go to work in the morning?

column1: You might have to file a noise complaint with the police.

column1: What is causing you to question whether it's the right thing for you or not?
column2: i have a new job offer, but im not sure if i should take it

column2: well, it is retail.  ive done retail and it is not fun.

column1: lol that remind me of a movie i saw with robert deniro , thats absolutly bizzare by the way but cool at the same time

column1: wow , i would love to have a cat like yours
column2: I know which movie you're talking about! I think they actually had to train that cat to do it. Mine just... learned.

column1: Aww thats too bad that no one else could go.  What concert was it?

column1: haha that must have been a crazy concert!

column1: Sometimes that depends on the industry. If she works in ones that have high turnover it's not a big of a deal as, say, an administrative job
column2: This friend of mine is constantly job hopping, I don't even know what she does technically but she seems to get good jobs so easily, whereas when I left my last job I could barely get interviews.

column1: Well, I'm not entirely sure about the banking side but I wonder what she's looking for. Perhaps a small vs big bank culture
column2: She's in banking so there are definitely a lot of available jobs. And there seems to be a lot of turnover so you're probably right.

column1: OOO I love doing that, but not so much the upheaval in the midst of it.  What room are you going to be working on?
column2: I am ready to start renovating the rest of my house.

column1: Still, a new color can definitely brighten up a space and make it feel all new!
column2: I finished my kitchen, so the next room is going to be my family room.  Just painting it really.

column1: That's awesome!  I wish I could wake up that way every morning.  Did something specific make you feel that way?
column2: This morning I woke up and I was in such a good mood that I just started singing in the shower.

column1: Ha!!  Well I've woken up from a dream and been mad at my husband because of something he did in my dream - I guess it can go the other way too!
column2: I don't know, I think it was because I had a dream about marrying Scarlett Johansson.

column1: I've done that before... I enjoyed it too! I love looking back at old pictures and stuff
column2: I went through my closet the other day and found all these old writings and drawings I did when I was in elementary school. It was fun remembering being that little, how different the world was.

column1: Some of it but my grandma did save a lot.  I plan on doing that with my kids
column2: Did your parents save a lot of your school work like mine did? I'm surprised how much my mom kept!

column1: I love cheese too! What kind of cheese was it?
column2: For my birthday last year, a coworker gave me cheese. It sounds ridiculous but I was touched by her thoughtfulness. I love cheese!

column1: Gouda is great! Do you like prosciutto too?

column1: Oh man, those things are awful and reproduce like crazy.  We left our house for a week and came back to tons of them everywhere! The best trick is putting a little apple cider vinegar in a jar, a drop of dish soap on top of that and cover it with cling wrap and put holes in it.  They will gravitate toward it and you'll catch a bunch! Just keep changing it every few days.
column2: A bunch of fruit flies appeared in my apartment out of nowhere the other day. I think it's because of some old veggies in my fridge. Totally gross.

column1: Seriously, gone is good.  They do have bacteria on them and lay their eggs on fruit and veggies and the larva burrow into the fruit or veggie so its good you trashed it all. Glad you're free of them!
column2: Thanks for the tip, I will try that! I cleaned out the fridge and most of them seemed to just go away. I have no idea where they go but don't really care either as long as they're gone!

column1: Poor little thing, chicken pox are the worst. On the bright side, you still got to spend your anniversary with your husband, just not, you know, in the way you hoped. Hope you guys get to have a make-up weekend soon!

We realised she had chickenpox.  She was feeling so miserable and of course all she wanted was her mummy and daddy.  It was a bit depressing and part of me was devastated but our weekend away was not to be.  Sure kids always come first dont they?!

column2: I did, and it looks like I may be looking for a new job soon as they want to take the company in a new direction.

column1: It's a whole new world when that happens, I can totally understand. How'd you cope with it?
column2: I remember when I started my first office job out of college. I was nervous because I didn't know what to expect.

column1: It's always best to just open your mind to anything that could happen. It's the best way to learn.
column2: I just tried to keep an open mind and go with the flow. It was hard to get used to sitting at a desk for 8 hours a day, but I soon got used to it.

column1: Oh no, that's bad.   Have you had someone come out and check the hose?
column2: I found some mold growing out in the garage

column1: May be worth letting your insruance comapny know. Usually they have clauses that you have to tell them as soon as you see it otherwise they won't cover any of it.
column2: I ended up cleaning it myself, I think I got most of it out

column1: what is that?
column2: I was thinking about when we finally got to go pick up Rodimus after all that waiting!  I've never been so excited in my life.

column1: oh that explains it!
column2: It's our Rotty pup! Sorry haha

column1: Wow when the child just asked?!
column2: I saw a child ask for a candy bar that the grocery store yesterday. The mother spanked the child in front over every one in the line!

column1: I'm only afraid that the mom is going to let out that embarassment on her child once they get home.
column2: Yes! It was awful! Luckily the man behind her spoke up. I could tell she was embarrassed but I was furious at her!

column1: OMG that's so gross!
column2: One time I saw someone's dog pooping in my lawn and they didn't pick it up!

column1: That would be a memorable lesson to learn. The best lessons are learned that hard way, after all.
column2: Yes, I wanted to throw it back at them!

column1: Oh god. That's kinda gross.
column2: I used the bathroom at Walmart the other day. I walked around the store for about 30 minutes before I realized I had toilet paper stuck to my shoe!!!

column1: Rest in peace whoever touches that rack.
column2: I felt gross hahaha I kicked it off of my shoe and stuffed it under a rack. I hope know one saw.

column1: Oh dear. How do they let the parents know what's going on?
column2: My son just started a new school.  The communication with them has been terrible!

column1: That sounds really frustrating. I'm sorry that's happening!
column2: I sometimes find out but it seems so disorganized!

column1: Oh wow.  Terrifying.  All I think of is Johnny Erricson Tada, who broke her neck in that situation. Did you do it?
column2: We went to the lagoon a few weeks ago. My friends dared me to jump off of the highest cliff into the water.

column1: You did the right thing!  Oh fun!  I'm glad you were safe and had a blast!
column2: That was what I was worried about! I ended up not jumping off of the highest one. I was too scared. I did jump off of the smallest one. That was really fun!

column1: Do you feel ready for it?
column2: I have a test coming up in one of my classes this week.

column1: Awesome, hope it goes as planned!
column2: Oh yeah, I'm definitely ready. I know I'm going to pass.

column1: Oh how exciting! Did you take any pictures?
column2: I had about 6 or 7 hummingbirds in my yard the other day feeding.

column1: Awww...that's a bit disappointing, but really cool that you got to see them!
column2: No. my camera isn't good enough to get good pictures, they are so small.

column1: The market can be competitive if the price is right. They'll sell immediatley.
column2: I was trying to buy a piece of property that came up on the market, but someone put in a bid before I got a chance and it has already sold.

column1: That would have been awesome if you got it.
column2: It is a piece of property that my grandfather owned and I pretty much grew up on, I would have really liked to have owned it.

column1: That's good! That probably means you worked on it until it became something you're proud of.
column2: I worked for weeks on a presentation for work. I practiced over and over. I felt relaxed the morning of.

column1: Maybe I could learn from that. I get really nervous when I have to do any public speaking, so maybe if I just prepared for it better it would help.
column2: You are right! I was really proud of it! I'm glad I worked so hard on it. It lessened the anxiety that I usually have!

column1: What did they do to you?
column2: I was under the impression that my friends would pay me back.

column1: It happens sometimes. you may ask them directly to pay back.
column2: They owed me money but never paid me back. I suppose it's not a huge deal though.

column1: I totally get that.  I'm in the same place with my daughter.  I home school and she's learning them too. Give it time and she'll get it soon.  Its so much to memorize at once!
column2: I worked with daughter for months with learning her multiplication tables. We've practiced and practiced and she still doesn't know them all!

column1: That's awesome!  She will!  The best thing about homeschooling is that they can learn more at their own pace.  I'm not looking forward to division! ha ha
column2: We homeschool too! I hope she can get them soon! It will make this year's math so much easier!

column1: Do you hike very often?
column2: I'm going on a hiking trip soon

column1: I've never been hiking, really! I'd like to go some day.
column2: Here and there when I have time

column1: Oh, such fun!  Do you have all the Stamp It Up scrapbooking things I hear so much about? I bet it can be hard to keep it updated! They grow so fast!
column2: I scrapbook pictures of my son and I am a few years behind!

column1: Perfect!  Now you'll be caught up in no time.  I know you'll be so gratified to finish and be able to look at all of them when he's much older.
column2: My son just started school all day, so I plan to start scrapbooking.  I don't use Stamp It Up though.

column1: So sorry to hear of Sam's passing.
column2: This past weekend, my cat Sam passed away, he was 17 years old.

column1: May your many memories of Sam help you to sustain at this difficult time.
column2: Yeah,it's been really strange the past few days without him asleep on my feet while I work.

column1: That is awesome.  I'm with you on that.  Tough times might pop up now and then but life really is great.  I don't like to take it for granted.
column2: I have nothing to complain about. Life is good.

column1: Exactly! You'll go far with that attitude!
column2: No point in being a pessimist.

column1: Mmm, now you're making me hungry for cake. What kind of cake was it?
column2: I baked a cake for my boyfriend's birthday and it turned out to be so delicious! He was so excited.

column1: Personally I'm a huge fan of red velvet, but black forest is amazing too!
column2: Black forest cake! It happens to be both our favorite kind of cake. I made it from scratch. What's your favorite cake?

column1: Aww, I know that can be hard, but you can't be too hard on yourself.  Sometimes you don't have a choice.
column2: I felt so bad when I had to board my dog while I was on vacation. It made me feel like a bad dog mom!

column1: Absence makes the heart grow fonder.
column2: I know. She was so excited when we came home though which made us feel a bit better.

column1: What are some of your best traits?
column2: I'm happy with the person that I grew up to be.

column1: Do you exercise often?
column2: I'm healthy!

column1: Oh boy that is great news! I hope you didn't drop a pretty penny on it! Haha, and even if you did, dogs are worth it.
column2: So we finally found the perfect Rotty breeder and we got to pick up our puppy this week!

column1: Hey runts are the best! They need love too. Either way, I'm glad you were paired up with the perfect companion.
column2: No he was the runt so we got him on the cheap side!  He is sooooo sweet!  I am so happy

column1: I've never been, but it looks like so much fun.
column2: I love going to Disney World. It makes me remember all the wonderful memories I made there as a child.

column1: It would be so much fun to go there as a family.
column2: It is a great place for both kids and adults! I don't have any kids yet, but can't wait to bring mine when I have them someday.

column1: Oh yeah I am right there with you, I just don't even go out anymore if I can help it! How old is yours? Mines 2 1/2
column2: Sometimes when I am out in public, my son throws a tantrum.

column1: They are too smart for their own good
column2: Mine is 5.  Every now and then, he says a curse word, uses it properly too!

column1: what did you see? please don't tell me there was a bug in your bread
column2: I was just about to make a sandwich to eat, when I discovered something really gross.

column1: ewwww, so nasty! i almost ate a molded avocado today. good thing i noticed before scooping it
column2: No, there weren't any bugs. But there was mold.

column1: or maybe she just knows you're a great worker and very responsible? I hope you will get a raise after completing those tasks
column2: The head of marketing at my job recently dumped a bunch of new tasks on me and my coworker. I feel like she's just lazy and making us do her job.

column1: did you try talking to her about it? Just be straight forward and tell you how you feel
column2: Ha, that's a really nice way of looking at it but nah I'm pretty sure it's mostly laziness.

column1: Did you call the police?
column2: I can't believe this!  Some kid at the gas station nearly hit me and then had the nerve to call me awful names!

column1: Its horrible to have to got through things like thaty
column2: No!  I got so flustered and kind of paniked.

column1: That's great! I'm so happy for you!
column2: Guess what!  I nailed my review for this year and got a raise!

column1: Ooh, will you be managing anyone?
column2: Thank you! I worked so hard and I am so freaking excited!  I am also up for a promotion if we keep growing!

column1: I hear you! I drop things all the time. Was it one you just bought?
column2: I freaking dropped my coffee on the ground this morning

column1: Ugh! Were you away from home?
column2: Yes.  And to make it even worse I soaked myself!

column1: Oh wow, she's doing great. I know it probably feels a bit bad that she's making so much more than you, but hopefully you can find  away to be proud of her.
column2: My stepdaughter graduated from college in May and got a job in San Francisco making 3 times more than I have ever made.

column1: Oh well that's great! Some people would get a little jealous. I'm glad you're proud of her, I'm sure she worked very hard for her success!
column2: I'm definitely proud! It doesn't feel bad at all. I'm so happy about how much drive she has to succeed.

column1: That is a good feeling!
column2: Whew. I finally got all of my work done for the day.

column1: Nice! No kids at home?
column2: It really is! Now I can go home and just relax for the rest of the evening.

column1: Are you afraid of the dentist?
column2: I am so nervous.  I have to go to the dentist tomorrow to get a filling replaced.

column1: I'm sorry to hear that, I'm pretty terrified of the dentist myself. Ask for gas! Good luck, I'm sure everything will be just fine.
column2: I am!  I had a bad experience with one when I was younger.

column1: Oh nice! That's super brave of you.
column2: I spoke at a conference recently. I was a little scared going into it but felt great as I knew I knew my speech.

column1: That's a great skill to have!
column2: I'm actually one of those fortunate people who doesn't have a fear of public speaking.

column1: That must have been a nice feeling.
column2: I was cleaning out my attic and found a box full of old photo albums. I spent the next few hours looking at old photos and having a great time.

column1: I love that nostalgic feeling.
column2: It really was. I miss a lot of the people in the photos, made me really smile to see their faces again.

column1: Haha, sounds like my pupper, is she still young?
column2: I am so irritated.  My dog keeps trying to eat up my shoes no matter where I put them!

column1: Right!? It's weird, you buy them all the toys in the world, but they still go after your stuff.
column2: Yeah she's only about six months.  Despite all her chew toys its still my shoes she craves...

column1: Why he is working late?
column2: My husband works late at night and sometimes I'm stuck by myself.

column1: I understand. Could you plan to do something when he is late (going out with friends)?
column2: He owns his own business working on cars. If something goes wrong, he is forced to stay to fix the issue.

column1: Aww man that sucks for you
column2: My aunt just signed for my cousin to get an FJ Cruiser! That is my dream car! He doesn't even have a job.

column1: Hopefully! It is your dream car after all
column2: It does! Maybe he will at least let me drive it!

column1: That should be fun. Any big planes?
column2: I'm looking forward to visiting a friend over the weekend

column1: That will be nice to catch up.
column2: Nothing too big, probably just wander around town

column1: That's not very considerate of her. Was she a bad neighbor while she lived there too? Some people!
column2: I'm so irritated at my neighbor. She moved out recently and left ALL her garbage and old furniture in our parking lot by the garbage.

column1: I wonder what could have changed? Either way, I'd be pretty pissed off.
column2: Not at all, that's what is so weird! She was really polite, quiet, and neat.

column1: Oh no! That is terrible!
column2: Last week the plant I work at was hit with massive layoffs.

column1: I understand. Layoffs are hard. My brother in law has been through a lot of those at factories!
column2: I was fortunate enough to be one of the very few who got to keep their job, I am happy but very sad for the others.

column1: How do you feel these days?
column2: Two years ago my wife and I got divorced. It has been very odd in this big house all by myself.

column1: It must be difficult, do you think she will come back ever?
column2: It has gotten a little better with time, but still a pretty sore spot for me.

column1: Ouch! That's rather painful. What are you doing now?
column2: I lost my job earlier this year. I was really worried about how to pay my bills and finding a new job.

column1: Wow! That's like a paid vacation!
column2: Well that's the cool thing... the week my unemployment ran out I got a job offer. At my former company, no less. So everything worked out!

column1: Wow, that's incredible. What's their secret?
column2: Last week a friend of mine won $2000 on a scratch off ticket. I buy those things all the time and never win squat.

column1: Congrats to your friend. I hope they share!
column2: Right place, right time I guess. Some people are just lucky.

column1: That's unfortunate, hope you don't get it as well!
column2: My niece got sent home from school yesterday with that stomach bug that's going around

column1: I'm sure she will be fine with some rest and a little bit of time.
column2: I know!  I've been pretty worried about her.  She's such a tiny thing.

column1: Wow... that's kind of creepy actually. Were you able to get it back?
column2: My phone went missing. Imagine my surprise when I got a Facebook message "from myself," it was the person who found it saying "I have your phone."

column1: You're very lucky he was nice and didn't steal any of your data.
column2: I was! The guy was really nice and refused the cash I tried to give him as a reward.

column1: Did you bring them a pan of ludefisk first? What did they say?
column2: I just got some new neighbors. I'm kinda nosy so I asked if I could take a look at how they decorated, just out of curiosity.

column1: Next time they let you in, just steal all your favorite pieces of decor and replace them with brownies.
column2: Nah, although I did consider brownies. They were happy to meet me so it was all good. But man I couldn't believe how nice their place looked compared to mine! I am a little jealous of their interior decorating skills.

column1: Yeah, they are cute like that. How old is she ?
column2: My kid was signing The Spice Girls a few years ago. She thought she had discovered a new band! She asked if I had ever heard of them before.

column1: I have a 10 year old like that.
column2: She almost 11 now. She loves to listen to all of the bands from when I was younger. It's really cute.

column1: that's amazing. watching your children succeed is so rewarding
column2: My daughter practiced her gymnastics every day all summer. We just found out that she made the team!

column1: that is awesome. i hope she has very much success in her gymnastic endevours.
column2: It is! I cannot wait to see what's in store for her future! Maybe a scholarship!

column1: you are very welcome. good luck!
column2: thank you!

column1: That's awful! I hope that she didn't mean too!
column2: My grandma threw away my high school yearbooks.

column1: Yeah, It really sounds like she didn't mean to. Sometimes you can find copies online if you look.
column2: I don't think she realized what they were. I was pretty irritated as they can't be replaced but what can you do?

column1: I'm so so sorry!  We lost our chihuahua in February, so I completely understand that feeling.  Was he sick prior to passing away or was it sudden?
column2: We've had our dog for over 8 years. He past away this spring.

column1: I think it might actually be harder to watch our kids go through that kind of loss than to actually go through it ourselves.  Our pup was our daughter's dog and she was sick prior to passing, so we knew it was coming.  Still doesn't really help though.  We ended up adopting a pup from the shelter that had lost her human mom - it was meant to me - my daughter lost her pup and this pup had lost her mom.  It's helped, something to think about at least.
column2: It was sudden. He was completely fine when we went to bed. No issues at all. Its been hard for our daughter

column1: I am sure she will be smart with it
column2: I bought my daughter her first cell phone. It's a lot of responsibility for her. I hope she is ready for it.

column1: You can always show her the ways
column2: I hope so. She has done well with tablets so I'm hoping she'll do the same with a phone

column1: Were they okay?
column2: I accidentally knocked over a little kid coming out of the store the other day.

column1: At least you're not getting sued
column2: Yeah thankfully he was totally fine. But I felt so bad.

column1: Im good at that lol
column2: Oh man, that would be terrible. Way to look on the bright side!

column1: Don't worry you'll be fine.  It's safe.
column2: I'm going skydiving this weekend. My stomach all ready hurts with fear.

column1: I'm surprised you haven't started to relax a little yet.
column2: This is my 3rd time and I'm still scared

column1: I can only imagine. At least its nice in the day time though?
column2: We moved into a 200 year old house. There are creeks and cracks that creep me out!

column1: I am not sure I would do well in that house
column2: Sometimes. I try to avoid that attic during any time of the day! There's also a weird door about knee-height. When you open it up, it's just big enough to fit a storage tub.

column1: Bet that brought back good memories.
column2: After my mom passed away I found all our old cassette tapes in her storage, listening to those was pretty cool.

column1: Where did you guys usually go?
column2: Definitely, brought me right back to the road trips we took when I was younger.

column1: whats the competition on ?
column2: I've spent all day getting my kit ready for the next competition this weekend. I'm exhausted.

column1: Nice hope you win , ill be looking into this further
column2: Highland games. I throw the caber and heavy hammer.

column1: I wonder how that was noted on your report.
column2: I'm so angry at my self. I was in my performance review today and I passed wind in front of my boss. OMG

column1: Sounds like a wacky place to work.
column2: I got a raise so not that bad but it was still off putting. I've heard her rip one in the past so I guess no judgement.

column1: That is awesome. Congratulations. Im sure you earned every penny.
column2: I got a raise today. I've pushed my self hard this last year and I deserve it.

column1: Good things happen to people who put in the effort. It sounds well deserved.
column2: Thanks it's been a rough year. My hours were cut but I was expected to keep up the same work load. Thanks again!

column1: Oh no! Do you think it's a wild animal?
column2: For the last few nights I've heard weird sounds outside my bedroom window.

column1: I hope it's not a crazy person or worse, an alien waiting to abduct you!
column2: I don't think so, it doesn't sound like any animal I recognize. It's really creepy.

column1: Its so hard to monitor that stuff now
column2: I told my daughter she wasn't allowed to watch Youtube because it's hard to monitor. I caught her sneaking and watching videos last night!

column1: Yeah, that is a scary thing to think about too
column2: It is! There's also a ton of weird stuff on there that's labeled for kids.

column1: On no!  That is no good!  Is he still a puppy?
column2: I walk my dog for 30 minutes at a time but no matter what, he always ends up using the bathroom inside! I wish he would left me know if he needs to go out.

column1: Hopefully he is not doing it out of spite!  Maybe you should hire a dog trainer to see if they can correct his behavior.
column2: No! He's about 2 years old now. Sometimes I think he does it out a spite when he's not getting enough attention!

column1: No way? Do you have proof? That is terrible.
column2: My neighbor stole a package from me.

column1: Wow. That is horrible. I would get a camera and try to film them in the act and go to the police. I would be so angry.
column2: So check this out, I ordered a planter for my porch. That's how I know he did it, the exact planter I ordered and never got appeared on HIS porch a few days after my package went missing!

column1: you havent met all three people in the city yet?
column2: I moved to northern Alaska last year and don't know anyone.

column1: ah well it sounds like i hit the nail on the head
column2: haha. I live about 1 hour south of Barrow the most northern place in the USA and about 12 hours north of any actual city.

column1: What kind of job was it
column2: My coworker was able to find a new job after only looking for like a week.

column1: Sales do sound hard to do
column2: Sales, so I'm not really envious about that part as I'm not into sales but I was still upset that he found a job so easily and I couldn't. We both wanted out of that company so bad.

column1: Is he going to be okay
column2: My cat got sick the other day, he was really pathetic. I felt so bad for him.

column1: I am glad then, I hate to see pets in pain
column2: Yes, thankfully! The vet gave him some fluids and I made sure he got some food in him. He's doing much better today.

column1: That is quite an accomplishment.  Someone like that is really inspiring.
column2: My friend is a single mom who works full time. She just graduated college!

column1: Hahahaha, it's hard to compare yourself with that, but it really let's you know what's possible if you really want something.
column2: Right? I'm so proud of her. Her accomplishment really made me think about just how lazy I am in my own life haha

column1: Why? Were they not working?
column2: I think I got my coworker in trouble.

column1: He should have been honest from the start. It's on him not you.
column2: He called in sick, but spent the day at the waterpark with his kids. I didn't realize he'd called in sick, I thought he was just out. So, I accidentally told my boss where he was.

column1: Do you think your boss will tell him it's you that told on him?
column2: Thanks, that's a good point. Or at least let me know he's going to lie so I can cover for him!

column1: That's so cool! Do you do a lot of climbing?
column2: Saturday I'm climbing Mt. Elbert the highest Mountain in the lower 48. The nerves has started to set in.

column1: Wow, so a proper adventure then. Have fun and stay safe!
column2: Not so much any more that I moved to the east coast. I do more surfing now but I was able to get off work so I fly into Colorado Thursday.

column1: yea funny how that happens
column2: Drove past the area my Middle school was in today. It was gone. I hated it when I was in school but now that's it gone I'm sad

column1: well at least its being put to good use
column2: It was not even that long ago I went to that school. It's been less then 10 years. They did not even build anything. It's a park now.

column1: Hey congrats!  Is it in the same field?
column2: I'm going to job interview Thursday. I'm currently employed but I'm ready to move on.

column1: Heyyy! That's awesome!  I wish you luck! Will it come with a sweet raise too?
column2: Yes, I'm currently in middle management this would be the next step up. I'm excited and nervous

column1: Congratulation. What is he planning to do next?
column2: My cousin passed the CPA exam!

column1: Good. I hope it will help her in career growth.
column2: She's already working at a Big 4 firm so she's just going to stick with that for a few years. I'm proud of her, it wasn't easy!

column1: That's cool!  Maybe you'll get along great!
column2: I just got a new manager at work. She is really young but seems to be full of good ideals.

column1: lol why do you have to steer clear?
column2: I plan to steer clear. I'm going to relocate in January so I just need to lay low. I hope she does a great job.

column1: ahhh.  I got you!  Well good luck on the relocation!
column2: I'm not looking to make a good or bad impression. I just want to do my job and go home.

column1: That is a bad realization to come to.  Where did they all go?
column2: The other weekend I really wanted to go out, but I realized I don't have any good friends left.

column1: Yeah, that is tough.  Once you get to a certain age you have to work pretty hard to meet people.  Maybe you could join a softball league, that's what I did.
column2: Well I used to hang out with a lot of my coworkers but I left that job. And just kind of drifted away from everyone else. I definitely need to find a new sport or something and make new friends.

column1: It can be hard these days, money is tight
column2: The other day I was short on cash I needed to pay my phone bill.

column1: I bet that was a nice surprise
column2: So true. I lucked out though and found a $20 bill on the ground! I hope the person who lost it didn't need it really bad because it definitely helped me out.

column1: Did you get it all straightened out?
column2: I lost my credit card this weekend and then in the worst place Walmart.

column1: Wow that is awesome, too rare in these times, count your lucky stars!
column2: Yes I was very stun someone did a good deed and turned it in with my wallet and all the money in it I was very grateful.

column1: Oh wonderful!  I'm glad it went so well!  Did she already know some friends there or was it a new school for her?
column2: My oldest daughter started elementary school today I was so glad she had a great first day.

column1: Oh boy, I bet you were nervous.  I would've been too!  Sounds like she's got a great and fun year ahead of her!
column2: A new school that's why I was kind of nervous and scared but she loved it.

column1: That is just gross!  Have you spoken to her about it?
column2: My neighbor keeps letting her dog use the bathroom on her balcony.

column1: I hope the HOA does something about that - that's just disgusting!
column2: It's revolting. I reported her to the HOA but she keeps doing it. I'm going to say something if I catch her out there letting her dog out.

column1: Bet that was a nice calming down.
column2: The other day I made fish tacos and did nothing else all day but relax on the couch.

column1: Did you get up to anything else fun?
column2: Very. It was nice and chill and low pressure, just how I like it.

column1: That sounds awesome, i bet you feel proud! Its nice to do things for kids who are in need.
column2: I did a walk a thon last week for back to school drive and needy kids it was s long walk but I finished it I felt so happy.

column1: Of course! Dont let fear of not finishing stop you from doing anything!
column2: I did before the walk I was un-assured I would finish but I did so I was overly proud and it was a great cause that raised lots of money.

column1: Oh gross, I would lose my appetite
column2: Went out to eat with my boyfriend the other day. Saw our waiter pick his nose and wipe it on his shirt.

column1: Yeah, I would probably just leave the restaurant altogether
column2: It really was gross. I was so grossed out I asked to get moved to the bar so we could get a different server.

column1: Oh my goodness, that is no fun.  Was it poisonous?
column2: I am so scared of snakes there was one in my back yard a few weeks ago.

column1: They can still bite, so it's better safe than sorry.  My father-in-law just got bitten by a black snake recently-not poisonous-but still painful.
column2: When I looked it up on line it was one of the garden snakes but I'm still frightened by them all lol even the harmless ones.

column1: Do you have OCD?
column2: I'm a neat freak and my house has to stay clean and in place always such a pet peeve of mines.

column1: I just love when the house is clean, makes you feel good.

column1: That sounds terrifying! Im glad you have a basement though, it can be so dangerous if you have no underground place to shelter in!

column2: Yes, a lot of people don't have basements, and that would be really bad. It's hard to explain to a three year old why you are in such a dark, scary place, especially when the power is all out.

column1: Oh my goodness, are you alright? I bet you created a mess!

column1: I hope you can laugh a little about it now!
column2: yeah! The only thing that was hurt was my pride! I've never tried to check out so quickly!

column1: That sounds like a great gift. That is going to be a great time.

column1: Wow. I am sure you will remember this for a long time. You are going to have to think of a great surprise for him now.
column2: It is! I'm really excited for it! It's tonight, so it was also a big surprise!

column1: That's crazy, and a little heart-breaking too. I'm envious of the bond and routine it sounds like you guys had. I have yet to develop a bond like that with a pet. I hope I do at some point

column1: That was really nice of him. I know that she had to be relieved.

column1: What kind of school was she at before?
column2: She is in 5th grade.

column1: Oh no, no thank you! lol ahhh i cant even.

column1: Well you must be happy about it.

column1: Oh! that is bad then.  Be careful.

column1: I hope you hear good news.

column1: I understand. I guess you'll always feel that way.

column1: Does this happen often? I'd let my neighbor know about it.

column1: That's great! You must have been so surprised and pleased to hear from them.

column1: I bet you had tons of catching up to do!
column2: I was! It was so great hearing from her again.

column1: The way you wrote that makes it seem like you're anticipating something bad... Do you mind if I ask what you're expecting to happen?

column1: Interesting... well then at least that leaves the possibility for something good instead. If you're not sure what it could be, then at least it's not some obvious mistake or negligence on your part. I hope for the best for you
column2: See, that's the thing... I have no idea what to expect. That's why I'm so nervous about it.

column1: That is unfortunate, my own mother was ill for several years, she is getting older as well. Do you get to see her often?
column2: My mother is getting very old. And she really isn't in great health these days...

column1: Just spend what time you can with her, I'd like to say something really profound but aging parents is a situation that just sucks. Sorry you are having to deal with it.

column1: That was great of him!

column1: He sounds very nice!

column1: Im sure they had a good excuse.

column1: Oh I see. Hopefully its just that one time where he couldnt get to his phone to let you know.

column1: I am sure you will as well. Confidence is great!

column1: Congratulations. You have done great!

column1: That's really cool. What kind of car?

column1: That  sounds like a really awesome car!

column1: I was going to say, yeah, that's the kind of thing I would love to preserve in a frame or something for my office. How cool!

column1: Who did you go see? And are you still friends with all the same people? I wonder if any of them kept their ticket stubs too.

column1: that stinks. what did you do?

column1: oh that is awesome. and you got a fancy pen out of it

column1: Did it went well?

column1: That is great. What was the issue with your ear?
column2: Yeah it went really well actually, the result was better than I had hoped for in fact!

column1: you made quick work out of that

column1: i wish i could unload that fast
column2: Yeah, I was really happy that the unloading took as little time as it did.

column1: oh goodness. that has happened to me before. i could not sleep
column2: I was scared of the spider in my bathroom.

column1: how in the world did it get in your house? were you able to kill it?
column2: It was a brown recluse. I had no clue that I had poisonous spiders at my house.

column1: OOOOOOOOOO NICE!

column1: Well you two have fun tonight.  I won't tell your parents about all this.

column1: Why you need to thank her? Is she the one that helped you to find the new job?

column1: She is very nice person. That is great.
column2: She was a great influence and gave me words of encouragement to branch out and go for more then our company job.

column1: Oh. Will he be starting elementary school?
column2: I am nervous about my son starting school this year.

column1: aw he's at that precious age where you have to let his hand go, hu?

column1: Damn why'd you have to tell me that...Gawd that's freakin sad, jeezus

column1: I wish you and your fam peace happiness love and good health.
column2: I am soo upset, and worse I have to tell the kids when they get home.

column1: What? Do you have evidence supporting this

column1: Good hope that bitch goes to hell...sorry I love animals and my mom's dog died the same way

column1: That is a big deal.  What are you going to do?

column1: I can only imagine. At least you have each other

column1: Are you and your family okay?

column1: I am sorry, you can replace it though

column1: *There* oops.  Did you ever find out her name?  Or find out a way to thank her?

column1: On no! Did you have to walk, or did you call for service?

column1: Wow, you got lucky! Did you give him a tip?

column1: Why did you feel you had to cheat? I am sure you could have passed if you had studied.

column1: Well, don't let this one situation define you. Use it as a learning experience and move on, and do you best not to repeat it.

column1: Now that is quite embarrassing! What did your co-workers say?
column2: I accidentally peed my pants when I was laughing.

column1: That is wonderful!  She must be so proud of herself and I know you are proud of her.  Its great that she likes learning so much.

column1: Awww, what a great idea!  That's so cute! Where are you guys going?

column1: You are such a good person to do that!

column1: How has it been going?

column2: Its very boring since Im usally home by myself alot. NOw that Iim starting to date it wont be so boring.

column1: Oh god. Did anything happen?

column1: Well, I hope nothing bad happened!

column1: I watched it too! My favorite is Federer. Who is yours?

column1: I have for the past 10 years! It's one of my favorite sports to watch.

column1: That's great. Do you thiink you will get a raise?

column1: Confidence is super important

column1: good luck. even though you don't need it
column2: I agree. I have no doubt it will go well.

column1: That's great! You must be happy!
column2: My boyfriend came home from his trip early. I wasn't expecting him home for another two days!

column1: How come he came home early?
column2: I was! It was very unexpected and exciting. Although, I was hoping to have time to clean the place up before he got home.

column1: That's really thoughtful of you. Do you typically do things like that?
column2: I took my neice to volunteer at a homeless shelter this past weekend. She showed alot of compassion and love for the homless and needy.

column1: Perhaps I should find the local shelter in my community and do the same. I have never done that before and I feel like I should be giving back to those less fortunate in some capacity.
column2: Well I volunteer to help abused and battered kids. I wanted to show her things like this. I know she can be a good loving person.

column1: Yay! Do you guys have free time to spend together now?
column2: My boyfriend came home from his trip two days early!

column1: That sounds great, you should make him dinner to surprise him back!
column2: Yes. I'm very excited since I haven't seen him in two weeks.

column1: How long did that last for?
column2: I was so upset today because 2 people decided to block traffic because of an argument.

column1: Why didn't you tell them to move?
column2: for a good 45 minutes. At that it was during rush hour. everybody was so mad at them.

column1: You must really miss them.
column2: A few years back I moved to a new state.  Now my childhood best friends and I live in different parts of the country and I don't know anyone really where I am.

column1: Yea. Seeing each other on a screen definitely can't beat being with each other in person.
column2: I really do.  I mean we're in constant contact over the internet through instant messaging and video calls.  But it's not often that we all can get together and see each other in person.

column1: did he catch you doing something crazy?
column2: My boyfriend unexpectedly came home from his trip two days early!

column1: Thats good lol
column2: No, thankfully I was just eating.

column1: That's so sad. Do you have any other friends there?
column2: My coworkers last day of work was today. Im so upset she is leaving.

column1: I am so sorry for you. Perhaps you can hang with her after your workdays?
column2: Yeah i do, but she was the one I was closest to. Yes I was very sad.

column1: New York is a fun place to visit.
column2: I cant wait for Friday! I go on vacation to New York!

column1: You will have a blast.
column2: I agree. I never been there so Im so happy!

column1: Oh no! was it too short for your liking?
column2: So my hair dressed ruined my hair! Im so mad!

column1: Yikes! I would ask for a refund for sure
column2: Actually I had to shave my head off. She used new product that burnt my hair!

column1: Wow! Well a cheat day here and there might be okay! Haha
column2: So I lost 20 lbs onmy diet and last night I ate a whole large pizza!

column1: Right, but I'd say once isn't too bad as long you stay on track.
column2: I agree. I feel bad for doing so!

column1: I would feel terrible too. Where did you move to?
column2: I remember when my friends were helping me move out of our hometown.  We were riding in the moving truck and it came time to drop them off and say goodbye.  We all felt terrible.

column1: I've moved almost half a dozen times in my life before, so I completely understand. Those were rough times.
column2: I moved to a town about 30-45 minutes away, but at that point we were so used to seeing each other every day of our lives.  It was hard to get used to.

column1: That sucks, imagine being in an environment like that all day, I would go crazy
column2: The manager the store was very mean and rude to the employees. I could not beleive it.

column1: I guess some people are just really rude, no matter what position you put them in
column2: I agree. It made me sick to my stomach seeing it. I feel bad for them!

column1: I am so glad that it didn't turn out bad for you.
column2: I was very nervous and doubting to do it. I actually did and it wasnt that bad

column1: what did he do , how did he react ?
column2: I finally told my friend I was into him. He didnt take it too well.

column1: Well he is the one missing out and  i'm sure your very worthy of attention from some better.
column2: He rejected me and told me not to every call him again. Im so embarrassed. I should have known better.

column1: That's still really good! She did better than 25 other people.
column2: There were 30 girls. We worked very hard and felt she would place top 3 but what an outcome it was to be 5th.

column1: NIce! I bet you cant wait! Do you anticipate to releax or do things to catch up?
column2: I am very excited to not have any plans this weekend. It's going to be so nice to relax for two whole days.

column1: Very nice! I bet its going to be a good happy weekend.
column2: Just relaxing this weekend.

column1: Dang, and here I thought I was lucky winning a free soft drink in that contest. Maybe we have to pool our efforts together and try to win us something big?

column1: Why stop at 50? We ought to get 100! We need to show your friend and evil corporate Taco Bell who is boss and nab us some consoles!
column2: I know, man just got together and buy like 50 boxes and cross our fingers.  And another thing was he got it on his first try both times.

column1: Did you let him?

column1: You are good to allow him to borrow the car.
column2: We have been practicing together in my car , so I feel I can let him.

column1: Wow, I really like to do that. I hope you will enjoy it..
column2: Im planning on going sky diving this weekend!

column1: Ah ok. If you try once you will be alright next time..
column2: I dont know. I hate heights, so im very nervous about it

column1: That sounds revolting! Have you said anything to him about it?

column1: That sounds like a good plan. Perhaps you should request a formal resume from any potential roommates for your future abode.
column2: No. I'm not very confrontational. And our lease is up in two months anyway so I'm just going to wait it out.

column1: That was very rude of her to do that, some people just have no manners.
column2: well the library is very small so limited seats so I had to sit there and listen to it. I was so frusterated

column1: That's good, I hope you do well! How did you prepare?

column1: I see.I bet you and him are happy to be able to spend a little time together.
column2: His business trip wrapped up a few days earlier than planned.

column1: I'm sorry to hear. Why is that?
column2: I doubt I will get any sleep waiting for tomorrow.

column1: Oh, well that is a fine thing indeed! I would be  jumping up and down!
column2: I am finally getting to take the kids to Disneyland!

column2: I had to go out of town by myself for three weeks. It was hard not being able to talk to anyone I knew.

column1: Ah I see. Staying focused is hard, especially when your lonely.
column2: No, I was too busy focusing on work while I was there.

column1: That's horrible! Is she going to try again?

column1: It must have been awful to see that in someone you care about. I'm glad she's not giving up.
column2: Yeah she is. She is going to retake some classes she made a B in. The look on her face after she found out was pricelss.

column1: wow , thats great. You must be loving it

column1: You must get a good sleep now to enjoy the New york later

column1: I will cross mine too! I hope ya'll win it big.

column1: I am so glad that you are. Now no more driving when your sleepy.

column2: I'm not trying to get arrested! I think I'll just wait things out until I move in two months.

column2: Thanks! It will be a breeze.

column1: Don't be. i think you will ace it.

column1: exam's are always scary. we just need to take the mind out of it
column2: I hope so. I usually do better than I expect to, but that still doesn't make it any less scary.

column1: Why not block the calls?

column1: Have you asked them to stop calling about this topic?
column2: I want them to be able to get in touch with me if something important comes up.

column1: Have you spoken to him?
column2: My upstairs neighbors make a ton of noise at all hours of the night. It makes it difficult for me to sleep.

column1: Maybe you should buy some earplugs.
column2: No, I don't like to be confrontational. I'm moving in two months anyway, so I'm just going to wait it out.

column2: I watched Wimbledon on TV over the summer for the first time. Those tennis players are so good!

column1: It is a great tournament, you should watch.
column2: Maybe. I hadn't considered it yet.

column1: So are they telling you good news?
column2: My bank has called me three times a day ever since I applied for a mortgage. It's been a week and they show no signs of slowing down.

column1: Oh okay. Well hopefully they give you a chance to breathe and decide what you want to do.
column2: Not yet. I just filled out the prequalification online. I haven't officially applied yet.

column2: Nope! She was going to make something completely different from what she usually makes!

column1: You are so lucky to find someone special online. That can turn out so badly sometimes for some people.
column2: I met my wife online 7 years ago and can't see myself with anyone else, ever.

column1: That sounds like fate? Being that both of you lived close to each other.
column2: Oh I know. I got lucky, we found out we lived really close to each other so we met up and it has been great ever since.

column1: Wow, watching kids grow up is hard. How has she been with the cell phone?

column1: That's great parenting! You have to trust that your children will make the right choices.
column2: She has been good so far. We are trying to limit her access to it to just a few hours per day. She also had to "turn it in" at night before she goes to bed.

column1: I am sure with your guidance she will!
column2: Yes, you do! Hopefully she keeps doing the right thing with it

column1: You should go, Otherwise the condition could get worse.

column1: Oh my goodness that sounds so bad! Did they charge you for the visit?

column1: You made the right move. They at least have to show up with that giant truck that sucks the tank dry.
column2: No. I just asked what it would cost to fix then told him I couldn't afford it to get him to leave.

column2: I bought a big bag of M&Ms and I could not resist it

column2: I do not think I can and feel ashamed that I cannot resist it

column2: She was really sad, but she appreciated the fact that I told her.

column2: Yeah exactly. I wasn't sure if I'd like it or not and I was a little unwilling to try it out.

column1: Oh that sounds worrisome, do you think you will pass?

column1: I'm sad to hear that but human nature is hard to fight. Honestly, if you have any alternative options or plans you may have to fall back on them.
column2: I'm fairly certain I'm going to fail and I feel awful about myself, but I just can't get myself to do it.

column1: That sounds intensive! How did it go?

column1: I bet that was so defeating! I'm sorry to hear that. I wish there was better quality control with some of these companies that deal in parts.
column2: It went awful. It turned out that the motherboard or processor were defective and we had to deconstruct it to return both pieces. So much wasted time!

column1: That's a good bright side to look at.
column2: It really was. At least my friend learned a lot about computers as we built it together!

column1: Did you save it or kill it?
column2: I found an injured spider with a leg missing in my bathroom a few days ago.

column1: It's missing a leg so its probably dead unfortunately.
column2: I saved it. I brought it outside and hoped for the best.

column1: ooh, I bet you can't wait to finish!
column2: I passed two trials that a company put me through and I only have three left.

column1: I hope you get it! Good luck!
column2: You got that right! I'm feeling pretty happy about my performance and I think I'll get the job!

column1: How did they go? Did you pass?
column2: I spent hours studying for a final exam.

column1: Wow! congrats, you should totally be proud of yourself.
column2: It went amazing! I expected to pass but I didn't think I'd get a 91!

column1: That's very sweet! I bet it brought up a lot of feelings inside you.
column2: I found an old stamp booklet my girlfriend and I filled out before we started dating.

column1: You guys sound like you have a solid relationship. It's always great to find those little pieces from the early days.
column2: Definitely. I felt so warm and fuzzy on the inside, and so did she when I sent her a snapchat of it.

column1: Did you get her number?
column2: I'm pretty sure a girl at the convention was hitting on me.

column1: Good man, I have a lot of respect for that.
column2: Nah. I have a loving girlfriend and I would never cheat on her.

column1: That sounds like quite the checklist. I'm glad you brought the beer you might need it haha!
column2: For my camping trip, I brought with me my tent, camping chairs, mattress, sleeping bag, pillows, med-kit, bug spray, food and beer.

column1: Well I bet you're going to have a great time. With that haul I don't see how you couldn't!
column2: Oh yeah definitely. Never have I ever felt so ready for anything in my life.

column1: Holy cow! Did you call him in?
column2: I saw a man slap his dog on the sidewalk a few times while I was on the bus.

column1: Oh man!  Do you have a dog?
column2: I should have, but last time my girlfriend did that the police ignored it. I was so angry.

column1: How come? And was it a pain to replace it?
column2: I just had to replace one of the window panes in my house.

column1: I hope he did a good job!
column2: I'm not sure what happened.  I had to have a guy come out to replace it, and couldn't meet him, so my wife had to.

column1: Awesome, I'm glad to hear that. Sometimes it's hard to find contractors with good reputation.
column2: My said he did!  I had quite a bit of confidence in him, based on others' feedback.

column1: How come you didn't collect them? i loved them myself.
column2: When I was a kid, all my friends had Yu-Gi-Oh cards but me.

column1: Well, they are expensive and you didn't really miss much.
column2: I think my parents found them expensive, otherwise I can't think of any other good reason. To be honest, I kind of envied my friends.

column1: Nice, Was it hard to start?
column2: I took up running and I started seeing a huge improvement in my cardiovascular endurance.

column1: Wish i could run close to 5km, i'd struggle with 100 meters.
column2: Unimaginably hard. But once I got into it I couldn't stop. I'm feeling pretty certain that I'll hit my 5km goal in no time.

column1: That's cool. Man, those tiny disks were easy to lose. what game?
column2: My younger brother was playing an old Gamecube game that I loved to play back when I was a kid.

column1: That's awesome. I get nostalgic about old games as well.
column2: He was playing Paper Mario and the Thousand Year Door. What an awesome game! It brought back so many great memories.

column1: That sounds horrible, Did you wash it or throw it away?
column2: My buddy drank way too much at a party and puked all over my favorite jacket.

column1: That is a really rough story, You should make him pay for another one.
column2: I washed it and it came out surprisingly. But at that time, I felt so sick seeing what was happening to my jacket that I thought I was going to puke next.

column1: damn, is he ok now?
column2: A few months ago, a good friend of mine that I look up to attempted suicide.

column1: Did he go to the doctors for help? anyway i'm glad he is OK.
column2: Thankfully he is. He's doing much better, but the thought still shakes me scared to this day.

column1: Oh no! Was it a fun night?
column2: I drank too much and passed out a few months ago.

column1: Oh heck! That had to be really scary for them! glad you're okay though!
column2: It was, but it got scary at some point. Apparently people were trying to wake me up by shaking me and I would not get up.

column1: Aww, that sounds interesting!  Are you in touch with many people from high school?
column2: I was packing up my house to move, and found my old yearbooks! It's so weird to look back and see how far everyone I knew in high school has come.

column1: I get that.  It's weird when I forget the name of someone I knew for years.
column2: A couple people. Fewer as the years go by, unfortunately.

column1: Poor thing!  Is he felling better now?  I hope he quit that diet.
column2: My brother went on a low-calorie diet and began shaking everyday.

column1: Thank god he is ok.  There are very dangerous diets around, better be guided by his doctor.
column2: He quit the diet a while ago as recommended by his doctor. I was a little scared but I knew it was just side effects of a bad diet.

column1: Were you nervous?
column2: I let my brother drive my car for the first time yesterday.

column1: That's awesome.  I'm glad he did so well.
column2: No, he's such a good driver. I knew I had nothing to worry about.

column1: That's lovely! I love waking up to awesome texts.
column2: Last week I woke up to a really cute text from my girlfriend and a funny message from my brother.

column1: That's so wonderful to hear.
column2: Yeah! I had a moment of realizing how lucky I am to be in the position I find myself in, and felt really thankful for my life and the people a part of it.

column1: How did that make you feel?
column2: My girlfriend spent a few days in the woods with no cellular service with her parents.

column1: I bet. I'm not great at being away from my boyfriend.
column2: Really lonesome. I missed her so much.

column1: That's great! What have you been doing to socialize?
column2: Ever since I've been on these anti anxiety and depression medication, I've been able to socialize a lot more.

column1: What kind of convention?
column2: Just talking to more people in general. For example, at a convention I was volunteering at.

column1: That's such a sweet thing to do.
column2: I volunteer at a dog shelter every weekend.

column1: Dogs are probably my favorite pet. Maybe I should take up volunteering for a dog shelter one day.
column2: Thank you, they're so cute!

column1: Lil Peep died? when.
column2: I'm still upset over Lil Peep's death.

column1: damn, him and XXXtentacion we're really good.
column2: November of 2017. Almost a year ago.

column1: I love puppies! But they definitely are a lot of work in terms of their hair.
column2: My dog sheds so much I have to vacuum my room practically every 4 days if I don't want little tufts of fur everywhere.

column1: I understand. Our puppy sheds a ton too and he isnt even that hairy of a dog
column2: You're right. I'm just so irritated, even if it isn't his fault and I love the big goof.

column1: Oh my, that sounds like an absolute blast!
column2: My brother and a bunch of our friends planned to go to a 15-person cottage in July.

column1: Did you stay for long? That would be a great vacation.
column2: It was. At that time, I couldn't wait for all the fun and games we would experience!

column1: What a great time! Is the cottage on a lake?
column2: We stayed for only 4 days because it cost us about $200 each for four days and nights, but I hope we can book it for a whole week or two next summer.

column1: Sounds like heaven!
column2: It's very close to a lake, it probably takes a two minute hike down through a patch of trees and tall grass to get there.

column1: Oh no! Did you get in trouble?
column2: One time when I was in Kindergarten, I needed to go to the restroom. The teacher did not let me, so I peed myself

column1: Aww, I'm sorry. Hope that teacher learned a lesson
column2: Yes, they called my parents and I was sent home. I got spanked

column1: It's wonderful peace of mind to find someone you can trust with your fur babies! Did you have a nice trip?
column2: Last month I went on vacation and had to find someone to cat sit. It was a relief to find someone that I could trust to come by each day and not forget.

column1: Aw, that was so nice! I'd love to find a cat sitter like that!
column2: Yes, I was able to go visit my stepdaughter on the other side of the country. The sitter sent pictures occasionally, so I didn't spend my trip worrying.

column1: How did it go? What'd you get him for a gift?
column2: My son had his 4th birthday a couple of weeks ago.

column1: It seems like all those years just flew by, huh. At least now he's getting old enough to start remembering all these great times!
column2: He got a remote control excavator, and had a lot of fun at his party.  It's crazy how fast he's growing up, though.

column1: Are you feeling zapped from the week?
column2: It's really hard to get motivated on Fridays.

column1: I'm sorry to hear that. I hope you don't have to work through the weekend!
column2: Yeah, there's a lot going on.  I ended up heading to work anyway.

column1: It never ends does it? I hope you keep your head above water though, it's all you got sometimes!
column2: No, I don't have to.  But there's plenty of work to do on our house!

column1: I feel that pain. Do you not have the motivation or just dont know what to do?
column2: I bought a bunch of dumbbells, and a workout bench but I've barely used them.

column1: I get that. Well if I could give any advice it would be make sure you have proper form over anything. Dont worry about heavy weight if your form is garbage.
column2: I don't have the motivation. I know the workouts I should be doing but also struggle with proper form a bit.

column1: Sure. I love working out.
column2: Thanks for the advice!

column1: How much pain are you on a scale of 1-10?
column2: i have a impacted wisdom tooth. I need to go to the dentist but I am apprehensive about it.

column1: Dang that sounds bad! I know you might be frightened of going but I think you should go. You'll be better off for it.
column2: on bad days it is about a 6

column1: That was nice of them! I bet you felt really cool hanging with them. How did it go?
column2: A few years ago, I was invited to Rockfest by my older brother and his friends.

column1: That is awesome! I love festivals, they're always great to unwind and even just walk around talking to people.
column2: Yeah it was awesome! I was a little scared at first but within a few hours of arriving there it turned into a total blast!

column1: Why not, have you have many temptations?  I know how difficult it can be at times to eat healthy, I struggle to do it too.
column2: I haven't been following my healthy eating regiment as strictly as I should.,5|5|5_5|5|5,

column1: I know, fresh bread is a big temptation to me, and what about sweets and desserts, do you have a weakness for those too?
column2: Yeah. Carbs like pasta and bread get me every time.

column1: It's really a good start to recognized that you should talk about it. We all need someone to just listen once in awhile.

column1: Aww that's sweet. Did you cry?

column2: Oh it worked fine, but when I pulled my laundry out it surprised me how the smell of that soap reminded me of my life all those years ago when I used it regularly. Isn't it weird how scents can do that?

column1: o no what did you do?
column2: One time I saw my husband looking at another women

column1: o no im not sure that was the best response

column1: That's understandable. I wish you the best in staying smoke free!
column2: Right. Not much that can be done about it now. I enjoy having more money now though for sure!

column1: That is great to hear that things are going well for you.
column2: Being a parent so far has not been anywhere near as difficult as I expected it to be. My daughter is awesome!

column1: I am sure that things will continue to go smooth since you have a positive attitude about it.
column2: Thanks that means a lot to me!

column1: How long has it been since the interview?

column1: Oh well congrats and good job!

column1: Oh that is awesome for your friend!
column2: My friend just won $500 in scratch-off lottery tickets!

column1: Yeah I can understand that. I would feel the same.

column1: That was probably not a good idea, how did it go for you?

column1: Well, you never know if you can do something till you try. I am glad you were able to do so well.
