column1: That can be kind of scary. How did it go?
column2: When I was interviewing for a promotion at my job. I did all I could to get ready for the interview.

column1: Awesome, congratulations! It just goes to show how great things can happen when you're prepared.
column2: It went great. I having put in all the work ahead of time to get ready, I knew exactly how to answer the questions they had for me.

column1: Good job.  Your coworker sounds like a shady little b**ch did you let him/her know what's up

column1: For real.  Glad you had enough self-respect to handle it, most people dont'
column2: I found them and gave them a piece of my mind. What kind of person does something like that.

column1: Aww haha how many bags did you bring

column1: Heey there you go...sounds like you're the resourceful one

column1: That sounds awful!

column1: That is a good attitude. Better luck next time!
column2: Well, not really according to analytics. I was really let down by the fact that it was a flop but I'm not going to let it drag me down too much.

column1: I was doing the same thing!  Hard work but so satisfying when you see the results!  Who is coming to stay?
column2: The house is all cleaned and ready for my guests. Wow, I was cleaning all day!

column1: I completely agree.  Mine can get trashed in 10 minutes flat from the kids.  ha ha. Oh, how fun!  I hope you have a wonderful time!  Yeah, you'll probably be cleaning all over again by the end of it but its worth it.
column2: Yes, there is no better satisfaction, in my opinion, than a clean house. :) My sister is visiting with her kids. They are staying for a week here at my house. I am sure the house is going to be trashed in the end.

column1: That sounds pretty disturbing.  Have you called the cops?
column2: My neighbor sits out on his balcony butt naked sometimes.

column1: I bet.  I wonder what he is thinking.
column2: No but that might be a good idea. It's just an awkward and gross situation.

column1: I certainly hope so,  Why do you want to move?
column2: I have fixed up house to the best of my ability. I feel very certain that it will sell very quickly.

column1: That sounds great, That is how I like my houses to be too.
column2: I am moving to a smaller house with a big yard where life will be a lot easier. Less house to clean and more time outside. :)

column1: Hmm, don't you need fat and protein in your diet also?
column2: I feel confident that eating a fruitarian diet will give me more energy and happiness.

column1: Oh I hadn't even thought of avocado. Well good luck with the diet, I hope it works for you!
column2: I have done a lot of research and so many fruitarians are thriving and feeling the best they ever had in their life. There is fat in avocados and avocados are considered a fruit..

column1: Oh wow! That is a brave thing to do! Your letter must have been a little intense if you are worried how they will take it. How did it work out?
column2: I wrote an email to a family member I haven't spoken to in a long time and I wasn't sure how they'd take everything I said in it.

column1: Awe that is great! I am glad there was a happy ending!
column2: Yep, it was full of emotion and a lot of things I needed to get off my chest. I was quite nervous waiting for a response but it turns out I had nothing to worry about. She was really glad I spoke up!

column1: Oh man I'd be mad too...you should wait outside with a paintball gun
column2: I get so mad when the local kids throw eggs at the front doors of houses in my neighborhood. It is so infuriating!

column1: Yup gotta lay down the law
column2: Yeah! I wish I had the time for it! I am going to buy one of the web cams and catch them in the act. I am going to teach them a lesson! But I love the paintball idea! That is great!

column1: Terrifying! What was it?
column2: I moved into this new house and was woken up with this horrible screeching noise in the middle of the night.

column1: Oh good. I bet!  I wouldn't have been able to go back to sleep after that!  Do you have to replace the pump?
column2: It turned out to be the sump pump, I guess it was old. But yes, it scared the daylights out of me!

column1: Oops. I hate when that happens. Did they say anything to you?
column2: I made a really inappropriate joke about a coworker to some other people I work with and it got back to him.

column1: That was really nice of you to apologize like that. Some people would have just ignored it. I know that could have been embarrassing.
column2: No, but the person who told him confessed. So I decided to be the bigger person and apologize to my coworker before things got too out of hand. He actually wasn't that upset and appreciated that I owned up to it, but I still felt bad for it, mostly that I did it behind his back.

column1: that sounds exciting! Do you bike a lot?
column2: I got my work done early on Friday so I got to spend the day trying out a new bike trail on my new bike!

column1: Doesn't sound corny. We all need a hobby to relieve stress!
column2: I've only recently started getting really into it. It sounds kind of corny but getting out there on my bike makes life just really... satisfying. Calm.

column1: How come you can't take them anymore?
column2: I miss being able to take my children to the park.

column1: Awww, well maybe you'll have grandchildren that you can take one day!
column2: they are all grown up.

column1: That's intense. I hope you did well!
column2: I studied all night for my final exam"

column1: Congratulations! That's great news. Well deserved
column2: I did! I got an A and I am so proud and happy !

column1: I totally understand. The same thing happened to me last week. I thought I was going to lose it!
column2: the neighbor's dog barked all night and kept me up, let's say I am not very happy right now

column1: Right, I had to end up calling the homeowners association on them
column2: i understand the dog is being a dog, but the owner does nothing about it even when i tell him about it

column1: Wow that is very clever. I would have never thought that could happen.
column2: My cat somehow figured out how to open the cabinet and stole a bag of treats.

column1: That is incredible. I wonder what else you can train him to do.
column2: Right? I wasn't even mad about it, I was astounded by his ingenuity.

column1: That is great! Hopefully he continues to be
column2: I feel like my husband is the sweetest man in the world

column1: Lol i'm sure you have to put up with him as well so its even
column2: I think he will. He puts up with me, and sometimes i can be a pill!

column1: Oh no. That's so sad. Was she sick for long?
column2: I was so upset when I had to put my dog down last month

column1: I'm sorry. At least she had a good long life.
column2: Not really. She was old and we woke up one day and she could not use her back legs. It was very sad.

column1: That is awful! Did you have insurance to cover everything?
column2: During my first year in grad school, my basement apartment flooded. EVERYTHING was destroyed and I had to start over fresh.

column1: Yeah that is horrible. I am sorry that happened to you.
column2: Thankfully, yes!! It took several months to replace everything that I could -- but even things, so many things I just simply couldn't replace.

column1: Oh no! I hope you didn't get into too much trouble by doing so!
column2: I am in charge of booking meeting rooms for outside companies at my job. Last week, I made a big mistake and accidentally gave a group a room for free when they should've paid $100.

column1: To be fair, everybody makes mistakes and it's bound to happen even to the best of us!
column2: Thankfully, not too much! I was simply mortified because this was one of my main responsibilities and I managed to mess that one up so badly!

column1: Sounds like that could be fun if you like your brother and if you like parties. Do you want to go?
column2: My brother and his friends invited me to a party tonight.

column1: Happy Birthday! I'm glad you were able to have fun and be surrounded by those that love you.
column2: I just came back from it! I'm actually still a little intoxicated. I must say it was a lot of fun, we celebrated my birthday and I felt very loved and happy.

column1: What was her reaction to that
column2: I drank a lot and told my girlfriend that I would definitely sleep with her best friend if she was down to do so.

column1: I am sure she will forgive you
column2: She was a little sad and surprised, but we had been talking about threesomes for a long time now so she understood. Regardless, I felt very ashamed the next day.

column1: That sounds like some nice relaxing quality time
column2: My husband and I have been watching TV together each night--once the baby is asleep, of course.

column1: Have you ever passed out together watching tv?
column2: It really is! it's the only time in the day that we're guaranteed to have some time together, just us.

column1: How old is your baby?
column2: Not yet - but I'm sure it'll happen at some point!

column1: And how long have you been married?
column2: 8 months old - but by looking at him, you'd think he was a two-year-old. Thanks for asking!

column1: that is exciting! will it be your first house?
column2: My wife and I found the perfect house for sale and we excited to put a bid in on it.

column1: that is no good! hopefully yall will find a better one
column2: Well it would have been, but someone got a bid in before us and it ended up being sold. My wife was so sad.

column1: You must really trust your friend! How did that turn out?
column2: I let my friend watch my dog last weekend.

column1: Good to hear that it went so well. Do you think you'll let your friend watch him again?
column2: It was good, he (the dog) seemed really happy when I got back. He said that he let my dog out a bunch and even took him to the park!

column1: Oh no, what did you do?
column2: I once almost ruined my husband's master's thesis presentation--something he needed to pass to get his degree.

column1: Don't worry, from what you said it doesn't sound like you almost ruined it. It wasn't something on purpose at least.
column2: I started coughing--badly. He and everyone else stopped to look at me and make sure I was okay. He was so distracted after that!

column1: Lol that makes a lot of sense?
column2: I was expecting a surprise birthday party today.

column1: well that sounds fun!
column2: Yeah I had a few hints. My expectations were somewhat true; my brother's friend celebrated not only my birthday party, but two other birthdays today. It was wonderful!

column1: Haha caught red handed!
column2: Last week while my wife were out for dinner at a restaurant, I got up to use the restroom and walked by the kitchen. I saw a cook pick up a piece of chicken off the floor and put it back on someone's plate.

column1: Yeah, I wonder what their bathrooms are like if that's their service
column2: We proceeded to leave the restaurant, but not after informing the manager, very loudly, about the incident.

column1: Don't worry about it you will do fine. Kindergarten isn't too hard. Just don't eat the glue.
column2: I hope I do well when I start school soon, I can't help but think it will be too hard.

column1: Oh I see. My mistake. I was wondering how you could type and spell so well for a 6 year old. Well good luck in college!
column2: Lmao. It's actually my junior year of mech engineering.

column1: Did he try to get another diploma in this profession area?
column2: My husband's been searching for a professional job but can't seem to land one after interviewing.

column1: That is a good news. I hope he get it.
column2: Well, he has a masters degree and graduate certificate already. He's had a fourth interview for a position last Thursday -- so we are hoping this one will finally be the one!

column1: Surgery on my kids always scares me but I have heard that it is best to have them taken out while they are young
column2: Last month my son had to have surgery to have his tonsils removed.

column1: I understand, when it comes to our kids and being worried about them it feels like time stand still
column2: Yeah, I was terrified. I just wandering around the waiting room the entire time till they came and told me everything went fine. Seemed like it took days.

column1: Oh for sure. I hate having to cook and do dishes after a long hard day
column2: Isn't it nice when people bring you food, when you've had a long day?

column1: Were at work today or doing something else?
column2: Exactly! My boyfriend brought me dinner the other night. I had no groceries and just didn't feel like going out after a long stressful day. I was so thankful.

column1: Interesting. How do you feel about it? Do you find it fun and interesting, or wish she were more responsible with her money?
column2: My little sister has been going all across the country this summer, spending lots of time on money on pop concert after pop concert.

column1: Yeah, I can understand that. Sometimes when you're not in a position to enjoy yourself because you're busy being tied down with responsibilities, it's easy to get mad at others. Whatever you can do to spin it positively, I would suggest that. Being negative about it will only make everyone's lives worse.
column2: Mostly I'm a bit frustrated that she's got so much money to blow on these concerts! And to travel all across the country!

column1: Oh my gosh!  That had to be super scary!
column2: During this past spring during a bad storm, we had a tornado touch down in my neighbors yard.

column1: Yeah, thank god you are safe.  I don't know what I would have done if that happened to me.
column2: It sounded like a train going by the house from the basement. Thankfully no one was hurt.

column1: Yep I thinks its disrespectful and petty. What happened?
column2: I don't like joining it when people talk about someone that's not there, just like what happened yesterday.

column1: Thats good. I am amazed by people who think its okay to do that.
column2: He was talking about my other friend who is a bit annoying sometimes. While I may agree I just don't like talking behind someones back.

column1: Sounds like your co workers respect you then
column2: I work at a library cataloging materials and am often asked to help my coworkers--it makes me feel like an expert, though I'm not.

column1: Or that as well ha
column2: They seem to. Or, at least, they know whom is the right person to go to for those specific kinds of questions!

column1: Did you ever get caught?
column2: When I was a young kid, I stole some comic books from the local grocery store.

column1: Was she disappointed?
column2: My mother found out and made me walk them back into the store and give them to the manager. That was a humbling experience.

column1: How many month earlier he came?
column2: When I went into labor with my son, it was quite the ordeal. He came before he was supposed to.

column1: Is he healthy?
column2: It was actually only a week--but he wasn't showing signs of being physically ready was the problem. Thankfully, I'd already had my bags packed for weeks so we went to the hospital ready!

column1: whatwas the exam for?
column2: One time I studied all night for my final exam!

column1: tha is really cool what was your grade
column2: It was for Organic Chemistry

column1: What are they arguing about?
column2: One of my coworkers has been arguing with his supervisor a LOT lately.

column1: That's so ridiculous!
column2: Everything and anything. It's annoying, though--he's not getting fired and is, in fact, getting more hours despite arguing all the time!
